Subsection.Text: A person commits the crime of commercial bribe receiving if the person solicits, accepts, or agrees to accept a benefit with intent to violate a statutory or common-law duty to which that person is subject as:

Paragraph.Text: An agent or employee of another;
A trustee, guardian, or other fiduciary;
A lawyer, physician, accountant, appraiser, or other professional adviser;
An officer, director, partner, manager, or other participant in the direction of the affairs of an organization; or
An arbitrator or other purportedly disinterested adjudicator or referee.

Subsection.Text: Commercial bribe receiving is a third degree felony, punishable as provided in s. 775.082, s. 775.083, or s. 775.084.
